tit.j: 二上山 (奈良県・大阪府)
tit.e: Mt. Nijo (a mountain located between Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture)
Mt. Nijo (a mountain stretching in Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture)
Mt. Nijo (a mountain stretching in Nara Prefecture and Osaka Prefecture)

sen.j: 二上山（にじょうざん）は、奈良県葛城市と大阪府南河内郡太子町 (大阪府)を跨いでいる山。
sen.e: Mt. Nijo is a mountain situated between Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture, and Taishi-cho, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 南河内郡: 用語集には複数の訳語が登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い「Minamikawachi County」としました。
sen.e: Mt. Nijo is a mountain that stretches over Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture, and Taishi-cho, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture.
Mt. Nijo is a mountain that stretches over Katsuragi City, Nara Prefecture, and Taishi-cho, Minamikawachi County, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 金剛山地の北部に位置する。
sen.e: It is located in the northern part of Kongo mountainous district.
It is located in the northern part of Kongo mountainous district.
It is located in the northern part of Kongo mountainous district.

sen.j: 古来、「ふたかみやま」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: It was called 'Futakami yama' (Mt. Futakami) in ancient times.
It was called 'Futakami yama' (Mt. Futakami) in ancient times.
It was called 'Futakami yama' (Mt. Futakami) in ancient times.

sen.j: 厳密には北方の「雄岳」（517m）と、南方の「雌岳」（474m）の2つの山頂がある。
sen.e: Strictly speaking, it has two peaks, namely, Odake in the north (altitude: 517 m) and Medake in the south (altitude: 474 m).
Strictly speaking, it has two peaks, namely, Odake in the north (altitude: 517 m) and Medake in the south (altitude: 474 m).
Strictly speaking, it has two peaks, namely, Odake in the north (altitude: 517 m) and Medake in the south (altitude: 474 m).

sen.j: 金剛山地の北部に位置。
sen.e: It is located in the north of Kongo mountainous district.
It is located in the northern part of Kongo mountainous district.
sen.cmt: 上から5番目の文の表現に合わせる
sen.e: It is located in the northern part of Kongo mountainous district.

sen.j: 金剛生駒紀泉国定公園の区域でもあり、自然が豊か。
sen.e: As it belongs to the Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park, it is richly endowed with nature.
As it belongs to the Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park, it is richly endowed with nature.
As it belongs to the Kongo Ikoma Kisen Quasi-National Park, it is richly endowed with nature.

sen.j: 北側には、火山活動でできたとされる屯鶴峯がある。
sen.e: There is Donzurubo (a place name), which is said to have been formed by volcanic activity, on its north side.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There is Donzurubo (a place name), which is said to have been formed by volcanic activity, on its north side.
There is Donzurubo (a place name), which is said to have been formed by volcanic activity, on its north side.

sen.j: 付近には、近鉄大阪線・近鉄南大阪線・国道165号（長尾街道）が通っている。
sen.e: The Kintetsu Osaka Line, the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line and the National Route 165 (Nagao-kaido Road) run through its vicinity.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Kintetsu Osaka Line, the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line and the National Route 165 (Nagao-kaido Road) run through its vicinity.
The Kintetsu Osaka Line, the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line and the National Route 165 (Nagao-kaido Road) run through its vicinity.

sen.j: 交通の要所となっている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is an important point for traffic.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is an important point for traffic.
Therefore, it is an important point for traffic.

sen.j: 南側は、竹内街道が通っていた。
sen.e: Takenouchi-kaido Road ran through its south side.
Takenouchi-kaido Road ran through its south side.
Takenouchi-kaido Road ran through its south side.

sen.j: 現在は、国道166号が通っている。
sen.e: The National Route 166 runs there now.
The National Route 166 runs there now.
The National Route 166 runs there now.

sen.j: 西側、太子町 (大阪府)付近は、「近つ飛鳥」（河内飛鳥）と呼ばれている。
sen.e: The area near Taishi-cho (Osaka Prefecture) on its west side is called 'Chikatsu Asuka' (Kawachiasuka).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/近つ飛鳥: 用語集には「Chikatsu-Asuka」と登録されていますが、用語統一リストに従い、ハイフンを削除しました。
sen.e: The area near Taishi-cho (Osaka Prefecture) on its west side is called 'Chikatsu Asuka' (Kawachiasuka).
The area near Taishi-cho (Osaka Prefecture) on its west side is called 'Chikatsu Asuka' (Kawachiasuka).

sen.j: 陵墓・古墳など、遺構が多く残っている。
sen.e: Many ancient structural remnants such as imperial mausoleums and tumuli remain there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Many ancient structural remnants such as imperial mausoleums and tumuli remain there.
Many ancient structural remnants such as imperial mausoleums and tumuli remain there.

sen.j: 二上山万葉の森や大阪府立近つ飛鳥博物館もある。
sen.e: A forest park named 'Manyo Forest on Mt. Nijo' and Osaka Prefectural Chikatsu-Asuka Museum are located there, too.
sen.cmt: 二上山万葉の森: 定訳不明。用語集には「Mt. Nijo Manyo Forest」と登録されていますが、ある程度整備された公園(http://www.jalan.net/ou/oup2000/ouw2001.do?spotId=27381ab2010002346)なので、「a forest park named…」としました。/大阪府立近つ飛鳥博物館: 用語集には、本博物館の英文HPの表記通りの「Osaka Pref. Chikatsu-Asuka Museum」という訳語が登録されていますが、「Pref.」はスペルアウトしたほうがよいため、大阪府の英語サイト「http://www.pref.osaka.jp/en/attraction/industry/design/design4.html」に記載されている「Prefectural」としました。
sen.e: A forest park named 'Manyo Forest on Mt. Nijo' and Osaka Prefectural Chikatsu-Asuka Museum are located there, too.
A forest park named 'Manyo Forest on Mt. Nijo' and Osaka Prefectural Chikatsu-Asuka Museum are located there, too.

sen.j: 東側、葛城市には、麓に当麻寺がある。
sen.e: Taima-dera Temple is located at its east foot in Katsuragi City.
Taima-dera Temple is located at its east foot in Katsuragi City.
Taima-dera Temple is located at its east foot in Katsuragi City.

sen.j: 雄岳山頂には、大津皇子墓地(がある)。
sen.e: The grave of Prince Otsu is located at the top of Odake.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になりましたので、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: The grave of Prince Otsu is located at the top of Odake.
The grave of Prince Otsu is located at the top of Odake.

sen.j: その他に、葛木二上神社（祭神は豊布都霊神・大国（御）魂神）もある。
sen.e: In addition, there is also Katsuragi-futakami-jinja Shrine, enshrined deities of which are Toyofutsu no mitama no kami (the thunder god who presides over rain) and Okunitama no kami (a god described in Kojiki [The Records of Ancient Matters]).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/葛木二上神社: 「かつらぎにじょう…」という読み方もありますが、「http://www.geocities.jp/engisiki/yamato/html/030615-01.html」等に従い、用語集に登録されている読み方を採用しています。/豊布都霊神・大国（御）魂神: 定訳不明。豊布都霊神のカッコ内の説明は「http://www.katsuragi-nara.jp/aruko_01_10.html」の記述、大国魂神の説明は「http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A4%A7%E5%9B%BD%E9%AD%82%E7%A5%9E」の記述に基づいています。「神」は用語統一リストに従い、頭文字を小文字にしています。
sen.e: In addition, there is also Katsuragi-futakami-jinja Shrine, enshrined deities of which are Toyofutsu no mitama no kami (the thunder god who presides over rain) and Okunitama no kami (a god described in Kojiki [The Records of Ancient Matters]).

In addition, there is also Katsuragi-futakami-jinja Shrine, enshrined deities of which are Toyofutsu no mitama no kami (the thunder god who presides over rain) and Okunitama no kami (a god described in Kojiki [The Records of Ancient Matters]).

sen.j: 二上山は、「近つ飛鳥」や「当麻寺」を絡め、ハイキングコースとなっている。
sen.e: Mt. Nijo provides hiking trails including 'Chikatsu Asuka' and 'Taima-dera Temple.'
Mt. Nijo provides hiking trails including 'Chikatsu Asuka' and 'Taima-dera Temple.'
Mt. Nijo provides hiking trails including 'Chikatsu Asuka' and 'Taima-dera Temple.'

sen.j: 山頂の付近は、奈良盆地が一望できる。
sen.e: From the area near the summit we can get a full view of Nara Basin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the area near the summit we can get a full view of Nara Basin.
From the area near the summit we can get a full view of Nara Basin.

sen.j: 雄岳から雌岳への途中から、大阪湾・大阪平野が(一望できる)。
sen.e: From the trail between Odake and Medake we can get a full view of Osaka Bay and the Osaka Plain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になりましたので、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: From the trail between Odake and Medake we can get a full view of Osaka Bay and the Osaka Plain.
From the trail between Odake and Medake we can get a full view of Osaka Bay and the Osaka Plain.

sen.j: 雌岳の南方からは、大和葛城山・金剛山 (金剛山地)の山並みを一望することができる。
sen.e: The south side of Medake commands a panoramic view of Mt. Yamato Katsuragi and Mt. Kongo (Kongo mountainous district).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/金剛山: 用語集には「Kongo-san Mountain」と登録されていますが、指示書に従い「Mt. Kongo」としました。
sen.e: The south side of Medake commands a panoramic view of Mt. Yamato Katsuragi and Mt. Kongo (Kongo mountainous district).
The south side of Medake commands a panoramic view of Mt. Yamato Katsuragi and Mt. Kongo (Kongo mountainous district).

sen.j: 二上山周辺は、火成岩や火砕流堆積物が分布している。
sen.e: Igneous rocks and pyroclastic flow deposits are distributed in the vicinity of Mt. Nijo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Igneous rocks and pyroclastic flow deposits are distributed in the vicinity of Mt. Nijo.
Igneous rocks and pyroclastic flow deposits are distributed in the vicinity of Mt. Nijo.

sen.j: (その)ことから、火山であったと考えられている。
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered to have been a volcano.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処(文分割で不完全な文になりましたので、カッコ内に必要な語句を補っています)
sen.e: Therefore, it is considered to have been a volcano.
Therefore, it is considered to have been a volcano.

sen.j: 約2000万年前の大噴火により形作られたと言われている。
sen.e: It is said to have been formed by a great eruption approximately 20 million years ago.
It is said to have been formed by a great eruption approximately 20 million years ago.
It is said to have been formed by a great eruption approximately 20 million years ago.

sen.j: 活動時期は、新第三紀と推定される。
sen.e: It is estimated that the volcano was active in the Neogene period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is estimated that the volcano was active in the Neogene period.
It is estimated that the volcano was active in the Neogene period.

sen.j: 最終活動時期は、約1400万年前と推定されている。
sen.e: It is estimated that its volcanic activity ended approximately 14 million years ago.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is estimated that its volcanic activity ended approximately 14 million years ago.
It is estimated that its volcanic activity ended approximately 14 million years ago.

sen.j: 二上山は死火山で、今後、噴火可能性はなく、地図で火山として分類されることはない。
sen.e: As Mt. Nijo is an extinct volcano, there is no possibility of an eruption in the future so that it is not classified as a volcano on a map.
As Mt. Nijo is an extinct volcano, there is no possibility of an eruption in the future so that it is not classified as a volcano on a map.
As Mt. Nijo is an extinct volcano, there is no possibility of an eruption in the future so that it is not classified as a volcano on a map.

sen.j: 古来より、雄岳・雌岳の間に日が沈む様子から、神聖な山岳として、人々から崇められてきた。
sen.e: As we can see the sun going down between Odake and Medake, people have worshiped it as a holy mountain since ancient times.
As we can see the sun going down between Odake and Medake, people have worshiped it as a holy mountain since ancient times.
As we can see the sun going down between Odake and Medake, people have worshiped it as a holy mountain since ancient times.

sen.j: 古墳時代から飛鳥時代にかけて、二上山周辺は、海上の交通の要所、大阪湾・住吉津・難波津から、政治の中心の舞台である飛鳥地方への重要ルートとなった。
sen.e: There were important routes from hinges of marine traffic such as Osaka Bay, Suminoe no tsu (Suminoe Port) and Naniwa no tsu (Naniwa Port) to Asuka region, the center of politics, on the periphery of Mt. Nijo from the Kofun period (tumulus period) to the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/住吉津: 用語集には「Suminoetsu Port」と登録されていますが、「すみのえのつ」(http://www.shiga-miidera.or.jp/serialization/shinra/134.htm)です。「難波津」として登録されている訳語に合わせた表記に直しています。
sen.e: There were important routes from hinges of marine traffic such as Osaka Bay, Suminoe no tsu (Suminoe Port) and Naniwa no tsu (Naniwa Port) to Asuka region, the center of politics, on the periphery of Mt. Nijo from the Kofun period (tumulus period) to the Asuka period.

There were important routes from hinges of marine traffic such as Osaka Bay, Suminoe no tsu (Suminoe Port) and Naniwa no tsu (Naniwa Port) to Asuka region, the center of politics, on the periphery of Mt. Nijo from the Kofun period (tumulus period) to the Asuka period.

sen.j: 二上山の南に、日本で最初の官道として知られる竹内街道が作られた。
sen.e: Takenouchi-kaido Road, which is known as the first Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation), was constructed in the south of Mt. Nijo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処/日本: 官道のカッコ内の説明に「Japanese nation」が含まれており、訳出すると重複するため省略しました。
sen.e: Takenouchi-kaido Road, which is known as the first Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation), was constructed in the south of Mt. Nijo.
Takenouchi-kaido Road, which is known as the first Kando (a road that is improved, managed, and maintained by the Japanese nation), was constructed in the south of Mt. Nijo.

sen.j: 前記の時代に謀反の疑惑をかけられて自害した、大津皇子の墓が雄岳山頂付近にある。
sen.e: There is the grave of Prince Otsu, who committed a suicide after being suspected of rebelling in the above-mentioned period, near the top of Odake.
There is the grave of Prince Otsu, who committed a suicide after being suspected of rebelling in the above-mentioned period, near the top of Odake.
There is the grave of Prince Otsu, who committed a suicide after being suspected of rebelling in the above-mentioned period, near the top of Odake.

sen.j: 万葉集には二上山を詠んだ歌がいくつか収録されている。
sen.e: Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contains some poems about Mt. Nijo.
Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contains some poems about Mt. Nijo.
Manyoshu (Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) contains some poems about Mt. Nijo.

tit.cmt: 岳のぼり: 定訳不明

sen.j: 古くから、二上山の水を農業に使っている大和国側の村人が、春に「岳のぼり」と称し、二上山に登っていた。
sen.e: Village people in Yamato Province who had used the water from Mt. Nijo for agriculture since ancient times climbed Mt. Nijo in the spring, which is referred to as 'Okanobori.'
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Village people in Yamato Province who had used the water from Mt. Nijo for agriculture since ancient times climbed Mt. Nijo in the spring, which is referred to as 'Okanobori.'
Village people in Yamato Province who had used the water from Mt. Nijo for agriculture since ancient times climbed Mt. Nijo in the spring, which is referred to as 'Okanobori.'

sen.j: 神を迎えていた。
sen.e: They held a ceremony to welcome the god there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They held a ceremony to welcome the god there.
They held a ceremony to welcome the god there.

sen.j: 大和高田市域の築山村・神楽村からも徒歩で村人が往来した。
sen.e: People from Tsukiyama Village and Kagura Village in the area of Yamatotakada City also went through Mt. Nijo on foot.
sen.cmt: 神楽村: 読み方は確認できませんが「かぐらむら」と推測しています。
sen.e: People from Tsukiyama Village and Kagura Village in the area of Yamatotakada City also came and went through Mt. Nijo on foot.
sen.cmt: went through → came and went through
sen.e: People from Tsukiyama Village and Kagura Village in the area of Yamatotakada City also came and went through Mt. Nijo on foot.

sen.j: 現在は有志により、毎年4月23日に「岳のぼり」が行われている。
sen.e: Volunteers hold Okanobori on April 23 every year at present.
Volunteers hold Okanobori on April 23 every year at present.
Volunteers hold Okanobori on April 23 every year at present.

sen.j: 近鉄南大阪線の上ノ太子駅・二上山駅・二上神社口駅・当麻寺駅のいずれかからハイキングコース。
sen.e: It can be reached through a hiking trail from each of Kaminotaishi Station, Nijozan Station, Nijojinjaguchi Station, and Taima-dera Station on the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line.
sen.cmt: 二上神社口駅: 既出の神社名と異なりますが、「にじょうじんじゃぐち」駅と読みます(http://www.kintetsu.co.jp/station/station_info/station07024.html)。
sen.e: It can be reached through a hiking trail from each of Kaminotaishi Station, Nijozan Station, Nijojinjaguchi Station, and Taima-dera Station on the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line.
It can be reached through a hiking trail from each of Kaminotaishi Station, Nijozan Station, Nijojinjaguchi Station, and Taima-dera Station on the Kintetsu Minamiosaka Line.
